title: PHPis_countable()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPis_countable()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Check whether the contents of a variable is a countable value or not: "; $b = array("red", "green", "blue"); echo "b is " . is_countable($b) . "
"; $c = array("Peter"=>"35", "Ben"=>"37", "Joe"=>"43"); echo "c is " . is_countable($c) . "
"; $d = [1, 2, 3]; echo "d is " . is_countable($d) . "
"; ?> Definition and Usage The is_countable() function checks whether the contents of a variable is a countable value or not. This function returns true (1) if the variable is countable, otherwise it returns false/nothing. Syntax is_countable( variable ); Parameter Values Parameter Description variable Required. Specifies the variable to check Technical Details Return Value: TRUE if variable is countable, FALSE otherwise Return Type: Boolean PHP Version: 7.3+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:

"; $d = [1, 2, 3]; echo "d is " . is_countable($d) . "
"; ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPis_countable()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPis_countable()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPis_countable()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
